img.alt: Perryville High School will serve as a shelter for those on the frontline of the fight against the

a.span: PHS to serve as shelter for healthcare, emergency workers

div.p: Perryville High School will serve as a shelter for those on the frontline of the fight against the cornavirus in our community, to help them protect their own families while they serve ours. Hospital, health and mental health clinics staff, law enforcement, paramedics/EMTs, firefighters and others who may come into contact with the virus while serving the community, but are asymptomatic, will use the PHS gymnasium as a barracks, and have access to showers, kitchen and laundry facilities.

a.title: Go to comments for PHS to serve as shelter for healthcare, emergency workers

img.alt: District 32 offers new program to help parents protect students

a.span: District 32 offers new program to help parents protect students

div.p: Perry County School District 32 is offering a new tool to help our schools and parents protect students.

a.title: Go to comments for District 32 offers new program to help parents protect students

a.span: Students, ADK bring cheer to senior citizens

div.p: Perryville Elementary School students created paper rainbows with the help of Alpha Delta Kappa, a women educators sorority, which will brighten the day of homebound senior citizens.

a.title: Go to comments for Students, ADK bring cheer to senior citizens

div.p: Perry County Middle School's boys' basketball team recently held an end-of-year banquet.

a.title: Go to comments for PCMS Boys' Basketball holds banquet

img.alt: STUCO supports Special Olympics at Polar Bear Plunge

a.span: STUCO supports Special Olympics at Polar Bear Plunge

div.p: The Perryville High School Student Council participated in the 2020 Polar Bear Plunge for Special Olympics Missouri.

a.title: Go to comments for STUCO supports Special Olympics at Polar Bear Plunge

img.alt: BLAST Council volunteers at Food Bank

a.span: BLAST Council volunteers at Food Bank

div.p: Perry County Middle Schools BLAST Council volunteered recently at SEMO Food Bank in Sikeston. Thirty students in Grades 7-8 along with sponsors Mindy Brown and Robbie Riehn, packed 600 boxes of food for senior citizens and repacked and labeled 1,000 cans of vegetables in just 3 hours.

a.title: Go to comments for BLAST Council volunteers at Food Bank

Go to comments for Make-up Days

span.strong: We will empower students to learn and develop responsibility, attain college and career readiness, and live respectfully throughout their lives.

a.title: Go to comments for Mission Statement

span.p: To contact the Central Office, Superintendent or Assistant Superintendent, please call 573-547-7500 Ext. 328.
To contact the Board of Education, please call 573-547-7500 Ext. 328.

a.title: Go to comments for Contact Us:

span.p: Perry County School District 32 is committed to making all website content accessible to all visitors regardless of disability. That commitment includes following ADA and Section 508 requirements for digital content accessibility and any future laws that may be established. We will use the standards and guidelines as established by W3C WCAG 2.0 or its updates. This is a work in progress; we have undergone a regulatory maintenance review with corrective actions as of February 2019; we are ensuring that new content is fully accessible, and are taking steps to bring legacy content into compliance throughout Spring 2020. If you have questions about our website accessibility or a suggestion to help us improve, please contact Communications Director Kate Martin at kmartin@pcsd32.com or 573-547-7500 Ext. 559.

a.title: Go to comments for Website Accessibility Statement
